data.text: CDC's definition of being "high risk for severe illness" lists cancer, diabetes, depression, ADHD and pregnancy among others as major factors. That includes millions of people https://t.co/vfKev6FkyW
@sabrinaamorenoo I honestly can't wrap my head around this. Hospitalizations lag cases. Why take information away from people that use case numbers & % + to determine their own personal risk?

Forgot to add if your county is at "medium" community level + you're at high risk for severe illness, CDC recommends talking to your provider about mask use.

Federal data from 2019 shows more than a quarter of the U.S. has no usual source of healthcare https://t.co/tdCVbXbKOS
@sabrinaamorenoo I don't "like" this but it is good reporting, Sabrina, thanks!

In Virginia, the localities where CDC now advises everyone to wear a mask indoors in public roughly overlaps with the cities and counties that have the lowest fully vaxed rates https://t.co/6kfqh8tXC0
